content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- Total blocks: 3
- Number of layers: 2
- Bottom layer: 1 red arch block
- Top layer: 2 blocks (1 blue cube and 1 yellow cube)

## Spatial Relationships
- The bottom layer consists of a red arch/tunnel block that serves as the foundation
- The top layer has two cubes sitting side by side on top of the red arch
- The blue cube is positioned on the left side of the top layer
- The yellow cube is positioned on the right side of the top layer
- Both cubes appear to be aligned with the edges of the red arch block below

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:
- Block #1: Red arch block with the tunnel facing forward (for the bottom layer)
- Block #9: Blue cube (for the top left position)
- Block #13: Yellow cube (for the top right position)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 9
    Step3: Move block with index 13
}
```

This assembly sequence starts with placing the foundation (red arch block) first, then adds the blue cube on the left side of the top layer, and finally places the yellow cube on the right side to complete the structure.
